topic.title: Recoreding from 2/7/2025
topic.text:
Frontend vs Backend

https://ufl.zoom.us/rec/share/UpUD5r5I2HnR6wXmyGHnP4hYIlvAytLbOYtjL20a_dKhjZ_00ecc63ioKW-3kQkO.0EUFfdFLEC-SoeL2?startTime=1738939228000 

Dr. Sounny discussed the implications of cloud-based approaches in remote sensing and GIS programming, emphasizing the use of Google Earth Engine and the importance of understanding front-end and back-end development. They also touched on the current demand for mobile-first development, the use of SQL servers, and the potential of integrating Google Earth Engine directly into ArcGIS Pro. Lastly, Dr. Sounny highlighted the importance of understanding the user experience and user interface aspects of a system, and encouraged participants to consider the broader field beyond geography.
Classification and having fun with AI
https://ufl.zoom.us/rec/share/UpUD5r5I2HnR6wXmyGHnP4hYIlvAytLbOYtjL20a_dKhjZ_00ecc63ioKW-3kQkO.0EUFfdFLEC-SoeL2?startTime=1738940545000 
The meeting covered image classification techniques, including the use of machine learning and large language models for categorizing aerial photographs. Discussion also focused on the limitations and potential of AI systems in geographic identification and data security, as well as the concept of atmospheric windows and their role in image classification. The conversation concluded with an encouragement to work on labs and refer to recorded lectures for further understanding.
